content.description:
Progenuitprogigno, -ere, -genui: to give birth to1 pedibus celerem et pernicibuspernix, -icis, adj. = celer, -eris, -ere alisala, -ae, f.: wing, 
monstrum horrendum, ingens, cui quot sunt corpore plumaepluma, -ae, f.: feather, 
tot vigilesvigil, -ilis, adj.: wakeful oculi subtersubter, adv.: underneath (mirabile dictu), 
tot linguae, totidemtotidem: (just) as many ora sonant, tot subrigitsubrigo, -ere = tollo, -ere aures.
 1:Supply Terra as the subject and Famam as the direct object.↩
content.question: In line 3, dictu is

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
